product_overview: Billigent is an enterprise-ready, Azure-native clinical intelligence cockpit designed to transform healthcare revenue cycle management by delivering AI-powered insights and automation. It targets reduction in claim denials, enhancement of clinical documentation improvement (CDI) quality, and acceleration of appeal processes, unifying evidence provenance, intelligent automation, and real-time KPI monitoring within a single closed feedback loop.
core_goals: Reduce claim denial rates by 20-30% through proactive pre-bill analysis.
Improve clinical documentation quality scores by 40% via AI-assisted recommendations.
Accelerate appeals processing by reducing time-to-appeal by 50-75% using automated evidence generation.
Enhance revenue capture by identifying and addressing missed documentation opportunities.
Deliver daily feature releases with rapid deployment cycles ensuring system stability and high availability.
key_features: Real-time KPI Monitoring Dashboard displaying denial rates, CDI quality scores, appeals success rates, and revenue impact metrics.
Interactive Data Visualization with drill-down capabilities, time-series analysis, and evidence graph provenance.
AI-powered Natural Language Query interface enabling users to ask data questions in plain English with contextual AI responses.
Pre-Bill CDI Review with automated FHIR data ingestion, AI-driven documentation gap analysis, and prioritized work queue for case management.
Conversational AI Assistant for case discussions providing evidence-based recommendations and documentation templates.
Automated Denial Letter Processing using Azure AI Document Intelligence with OCR and denial reason extraction.
Asynchronous AI Analysis for efficient background denial processing and user notifications.
Automated Appeal Generation synthesizing clinical data and regulatory citations to create evidence-based appeal letters.
Appeal Tracking & Management dashboard with lifecycle status, deadline management, and success analytics.
Secure Authentication and Authorization with multi-factor authentication and role-based access controls.
Database and system health monitoring ensuring 99.9% uptime SLA and sub-2 second UI response times.
user_flow_summary: Users authenticate via secure OAuth 2.0 integrated with Microsoft Entra ID and access the main dashboard for KPI monitoring and analytics.
Clinical Documentation Improvement specialists receive prioritized cases in the pre-bill CDI review queue based on financial and clinical impact scores.
Users upload denial letters (PDF) which are processed asynchronously with AI-driven analysis extracting denial reasons and classifying root causes.
Specialists review AI-generated appeal drafts assisted by the conversational AI copilot and submit these for appeals processing.
Managers track appeal statuses, monitor team performance, and drill down into KPI visualizations with interactive charts and natural language queries.
System administrators monitor application health, audit logs, and security compliance dashboards ensuring HIPAA adherence and system integrity.
validation_criteria: System accurately ingests denial events and computes denial rates with root cause classifications matching Change Healthcare taxonomy with >95% accuracy.
Dashboard KPIs refresh within 24 hours and UI responses for queries complete within 2 seconds at 95th percentile under target loads.
Physician query UI enforces non-leading template compliance with immutable audit and unique query identifiers per HIPAA ยง164.312 requirements.
Automated appeal letters generated by AI cite regulatory sources and clinical evidence with traceable provenance and pass human expert validation workflows.
Pre-bill cases are prioritized correctly reflecting calculated financial impact and risk stratification with user feedback confirming prioritization relevance.
Denial letter PDF upload and OCR processing achieve >95% extraction accuracy of CARC/RARC codes and denial reasons.
System maintains 99.9% uptime SLA supporting 1,000 concurrent users without degradation.
Multi-factor authentication and role-based access controls are enforced for all users, with audit logs capturing all data access meeting HIPAA security mandates.
Comprehensive end-to-end testing and security penetration tests confirm robustness and compliance before production release.
